definition: body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: More than 18,000 Mexicans stripped off, baring all for the sake of art.
sentences.chinese: 000餘名墨西哥人脫光衣服，爲了藝術而赤身裸體。

sentences.english: Naked I came from my mother's womb, and naked I will depart.
sentences.chinese: 我赤身出於母胎，也必赤身歸回。

sentences.english: Naked I came from my mother's womb, and naked I will depart.
sentences.chinese: 我赤身出於母胎，也必赤身歸回。

sentences.english: Who needs clothes when you can fight naked?
sentences.chinese: 如果你可以赤身做戰，又何須衣物？

sentences.english: The model posed in the nude for the painter.
sentences.chinese: 那模特兒赤身露體擺好姿勢讓畫家作畫。

sentences.english: And he left the linen cloth, and fled from them naked.
sentences.chinese: 他卻丟了麻布，赤身逃走了。

sentences.english: I went to his room and found him naked in the bathroom.
sentences.chinese: 我去到他房間，發現他在浴室裏赤身裸體。

sentences.english: It's considered improper to be unclothed in public.
sentences.chinese: 在公共場合赤身裸體被認爲是不成體統的。

sentences.english: When we are naked in public, most of us feel exposed.
sentences.chinese: 當赤身裸體時，我們大多數人都覺得自己被暴露了。

sentences.english: Which means I'm definitely not supposed to be in bed with a naked man.
sentences.chinese: 也就是說我肯定不能和一個赤身裸體的男人同牀。

sentences.english: Children and women must avoid contact with unwashed or unclothed application sites.
sentences.chinese: 兒童和婦女必須避免與未洗或赤身應用網站聯繫。

sentences.english: Pass on in nakedness and shame, you who live in Shaphir.
sentences.chinese: 沙斐的居民哪，你們要赤身蒙羞過去。

sentences.english: She took off all her clothes and ran out of the washroom.
sentences.chinese: 她脫光身上的衣服，赤身裸體從洗手間跑了出來。

sentences.english: The dawn which follows a battle always rises on naked corpses.
sentences.chinese: 戰爭翌日，晨曦往往照着赤身露體的屍首。

sentences.english: Early in his career, he made a pitch wearing no clothes to advertising executives;
sentences.chinese: 在事業的早期，他曾經赤身裸體作宣傳。

definition: not wearing one thread (idiom); absolutely naked/without a stitch of clothing/in one's birthday suit
to become naked/to undress/to expose (one's body)
to strip naked/to strip nude/(coll.) to find oneself a partner
lit. clothes not covering the body (idiom)/fig. poverty-stricken
to lie in disarray/to cut across/to traverse
